comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: The Vicomtesse de Rancougne (note spelling) was on a tour of the US, raising wartime relief funds to assist Paris artists affected by the war: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0E12F9385C13738... query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10F17F83F5512738... query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40710F63C5D17738... Her birth name was Giselle Bunau-Varilla. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50615F93C5F13738... Her father was Philippe Bunau-Varilla, a French engineer: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippe-Jean_Bunau-Varilla

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: pennylrichardsca:  Thanks.  We'll correct Rancougne's name and include information about her trip next time we update.
